summary: Email correspondence between Assistant U.S. Attorney and defense attorneys regarding redactions to Judge Nathan's opinion and order denying bail for Ghislaine Maxwell, and the drafting of a joint letter to the court.

persons.name: Christian Everdell
persons.context: Prosecutor in the Southern District of New York corresponding with defense attorneys about redactions to a bail denial order and drafting a joint letter to the court.

persons.name: Mark S. Cohen
persons.context: Defense attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell copied on email correspondence regarding redactions to a bail denial order.

persons.name: Judge Nathan

events.title: Email Correspondence on Bail Order Redactions
events.description: Prosecutor and defense attorneys correspond about Judge Nathan's opinion and order denying bail, agreeing no redactions are necessary and drafting a joint letter to the court.

keyFacts: Judge Nathan issued an opinion and order denying bail to Ghislaine Maxwell.
The prosecution and defense agreed that no redactions were necessary to the bail denial order.
The parties were preparing a joint letter to the court per the judge's order.
The correspondence shows ongoing legal procedures in the Maxwell case in late 2020.
Multiple defense attorneys (Cohen, Sternheim, Pagliuca, Menninger) were actively involved in the case.
